alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 9:06PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Canadian, Blaine, Caddo and Custer Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Low-lying bottomlands near the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 12.4 feet Monday morning. It will rise to 12.5 feet Monday evening. It will then fall to 11.6 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
